data.title: HOW MANY WORDS ?
data.solution:
message = input()
my_list = message.split(" ")
count_table = []
the_words = []
i = 0
while i < len(my_list):
    j = my_list.count(my_list[i])
    if (my_list[i] not in the_words):
        count_table.append(j)
        the_words.append(my_list[i])
    i += 1
j = 0
while j < len(the_words):
    print(f"{the_words[j]}: {count_table[j]}")
    j = j + 1
data.statement:
Write a program that takes a string as input and prints the number of occurrences of each word on a separate line.
The string always contains words. Each word will be separated by a space.
A word is any group of characters (alphabetic, numeric or punctuation).
Words are to be printed by their order of appearance in the string.

testCases.title: Spicy case with a lot of words
testCases.testIn: My dog is with your dog not in my home but in your home.
testCases.testOut:
My: 1
dog: 2
is: 1
with: 1
your: 2
not: 1
in: 2
my: 1
home: 1
but: 1
home.: 1

testCases.title: Since cases
testCases.testIn: Since i know the word Since i always say Since
testCases.testOut:
Since: 3
i: 2
know: 1
the: 1
word: 1
always: 1
say: 1

testCases.title: A ...
testCases.testIn: Just wanna say a a a a a a a and a

testCases.title: John the Ripper
testCases.testIn: John the Ripper is the tool, yes the tool
testCases.testOut:
John: 1
the: 3
Ripper: 1
is: 1
tool,: 1
yes: 1
tool: 1

data.inputDescription: <<Line 1>>: A string [[MESSAGE]] in which you have to count the words
data.outputDescription:
<<Multiple lines>>: Number of occurrences of a word in the format of [[word]]{{:}} [[n]], one word per line, where:
[[word]] is a word from [[MESSAGE]], and
[[n]] is the number of occurrences of [[word]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Write a program that takes a string as input and prints the number of occurrences of each word on a separate line.
The string always contains words. Each word will be separated by a space.
A word is any group of characters (alphabetic, numeric or punctuation).
Words are to be printed by their order of appearance in the string.
Input
Line 1: A string MESSAGE in which you have to count the words
Output
Multiple lines: Number of occurrences of a word in the format of word: n, one word per line, where:
word is a word from MESSAGE, and
n is the number of occurrences of word.
Constraints
Example
Input
not a book book book
Output
not: 1
a: 1
book: 3
